dcterms:creator: T. Lindeberg
dcterms:description: A temporal scale selection model that allows for the representation of temporal signals at multiple scales while ensuring that the number of local extrema does not increase from finer to coarser scales.
dcterms:title: Temporal Poisson model

dcterms:creator: T. Lindeberg
A. Friberg
dcterms:description: Models of auditory receptive fields that are idealized computational representations of how auditory signals are processed over time.
dcterms:title: Spectro-temporal receptive fields

dcterms:creator: T. Lindeberg
A. Friberg
dcterms:description: A theoretical framework for auditory signals that incorporates scale-space theory for analyzing temporal variations in auditory receptive fields.
dcterms:title: Temporal variability in auditory receptive fields

dcterms:creator: M. W. Howard
M. E. Hasselmo
dcterms:description: A study on cognitive computation using neural representations of time and space, focusing on temporal dynamics in neural processing.
dcterms:title: Neural signals

dcterms:creator: I. M. Bright
M. L. R. Meister
N. A. Cruzado
Z. Tiganj
E. A. Buffalo
M. W. Howard
dcterms:description: A study that provides insights into the temporal response functions of neurons, particularly in the context of the monkey entorhinal cortex.
dcterms:title: Temporal response functions of neurons
